build_chart.description: Ameritas uses a height/weight table (imperial units) to determine maximum allowable weight for various fully underwritten risk classes (Preferred Plus Nontobacco, Preferred Nontobacco, Select Nontobacco, Standard Nontobacco).

tables.title: Height and Maximum Weight Chart (Preferred/Select/Standard Classes)
tables.measurement_unit: imperial (height in feet/inches, weight in pounds)

medical_conditions.description: Ameritas organizes medical impairments into decision tables indicating whether an applicant is Not Rated (preferred), Rated, or Declined based on severity, control, and time since diagnosis. Below are representative conditions and their underwriting impact.

conditions.guideline: Current alcohol use = Rated. Alcoholism in remission (≥2 years abstinent) = Not Rated or Rated depending on overall profile; if <2 years, Decline.
Mild or well-controlled anxiety = Not Rated. Other anxiety requiring medication or with work disruption = Rated or Decline based on severity.
Paroxysmal atrial fibrillation or infrequent PVCs (skipped beats) = Not Rated if controlled; chronic atrial fibrillation or frequent PVCs = Decline.
Very mild, no hospitalization, no daily meds = Not Rated. All other asthma cases (hospitalizations, daily meds) = Rated or Decline based on severity.

Basal cell carcinoma or other benign tumors = Not Rated if >12 months ago. Melanoma in situ, seminoma = Not Rated. All other malignancies postponed/granted only after 2–5 years of remission; metastatic disease never rated.
Any CAD event (heart attack, bypass, angioplasty) = Decline or Rated based on time since event and treatment. Stable CAD >1 year may be Rated.
Active or complicated Crohn's = Decline. Mild, in remission (≥12 months) may be Rated.
Any medically diagnosed dementia = Decline.
Controlled on medication = Rated or Decline depending on severity. Hospitalized or severe depression = Decline.
Well-controlled Type I (no end-organ damage, age >25) = Rated; poor control or complications = Decline.

Onset before age 31 (any insulin) = Decline. Onset 31–45 any insulin = Decline. Onset 46–65 any insulin = Rated. Onset over 65 well-controlled (no complications) = Not Rated or Rated. All diabetic kidney disease = Decline.
Postpone 3 years from last use (if ≥3 years abstinent, may be Rated). Active use or <3 years remission = Decline.
Any emphysema = Rated or Decline depending on severity and oxygen use; mild stable cases may be Rated.
Any epilepsy = Rated or Decline based on frequency and medication; stable single seizures >1 year may be Rated.
Postpone until stable ≥12 months; if stable and no complications, may be Rated. Otherwise, Decline.
Any MI (myocardial infarction) within past 12 months = Decline. >12 months and stable on medication = Rated.
Any HIV infection or AIDS = Decline.
Cholesterol <240, Chol/HDL <6.5, controlled on meds = Not Rated. Cholesterol 240–270 or meds = Rated. >270 uncontrolled = Decline.
Well controlled (≤135/85 age ≤60 or ≤140/85 age 61+) = Not Rated. Moderately controlled (≤150/90) = Rated. Poorly controlled >150/90 = Decline.
Medical marijuana use under supervision = Not Rated. Recreational moderate use (intermittent) = Rated or Standard Nontobacco. Heavy use = Tobacco rates or Decline if severe.
Stable, single or multiple episodes ≥12 months ago = Rated. All other MS cases = Decline.
Within 3 months of implantation = Rated or Decline. >3 months and stable = Rated or Not Rated based on overall cardiac profile.
Stable, early-stage cases = Rated. All other Parkinson's cases = Decline.
Rare or no treatment, minimal joint involvement = Rated. Methotrexate/Prednisone use or disability from RA = Decline.
Successfully treated, compliant with CPAP and no comorbidities = Not Rated. Untreated or severe = Rated or Decline.
Stroke or TIA within past 12 months = Decline. 12–24 months ago = Rated. >24 months and stable = Rated or possibly Not Rated if minimal residual effects.
Active disease within past 12 months = Decline. Remission ≥12 months on no systemic steroids = Rated.

laboratory_requirements.description: Ameritas determines required medical tests based on issue age and total coverage amount. Nonmedical issues apply at lower face bands, while increasing face amounts trigger paramedical exams, blood profiles, EKGs, APS, and financial documentation.

tables.title: Medical Requirements by Age & Coverage Amount

risk_classes.description: Ameritas offers six fully underwritten life risk classifications based on health, build, family history, and lifestyle factors.

classes.name: Preferred Plus Nontobacco
criteria: No nicotine use in last 5 years (including gum, patch, cigar, pipe, e-cigarettes; exception: ≤2 cigars/month with negative cotinine test)
Blood pressure ≤ 135/85 (age ≤60) or ≤140/85 (age 61+), no treatment
Total cholesterol/HDL ratio ≤ 5.0, no medication
Height/weight within Preferred Plus limits (see Build Chart)
No heart disease, diabetes, stroke, cancer, or lung disease in personal history
No alcohol/drug abuse or treatment in last 10 years
No DWI/DUI/OWI or reckless driving in last 5 years
No hazardous avocations or private aviation (except scheduled airline crew)
Family history: No death in parent/sibling < age 60 from CAD, CVD, diabetes, or cancer

classes.name: Preferred Nontobacco
criteria: No nicotine use in last 2 years (exception: ≤2 cigars/month with negative cotinine test)
Blood pressure ≤ 140/85 (age ≤60) or ≤150/90 (age 61+), no treatment
Total cholesterol/HDL ratio ≤ 5.5, no medication
Height/weight within Preferred limits (see Build Chart)
No heart disease, diabetes, stroke, cancer, or lung disease in personal history
No alcohol/drug abuse or treatment in last 10 years
No DWI/DUI/OWI or reckless driving in last 5 years
No hazardous avocations or private aviation (private pilots considered individually)
Family history: No parent/sibling death < age 60 from CAD, CVD, diabetes, or cancer

classes.name: Select Nontobacco
criteria: No nicotine use in last 12 months (exception: ≤2 cigars/month with negative cotinine test)
Blood pressure ≤ 150/90, no treatment
Total cholesterol/HDL ratio ≤ 6.5, no medication
Height/weight within Select limits (see Build Chart)
No heart disease, stroke, or cancer (excluding certain long-remission basal cell/Bowen's disease, testicular/thyroid/cervical cancers >20 years ago)
No alcohol/drug abuse or treatment in last 8 years
No DWI/DUI/OWI or reckless driving in last 3 years
No hazardous avocations or private aviation (private pilots considered individually)
Family history: ≤1 parent/sibling event (death or diagnosis) < age 60 from listed conditions

classes.name: Standard Nontobacco
criteria: No nicotine use in last 12 months (exception: ≤2 cigars/month with negative cotinine test)
Height/weight within Standard limits (see Build Chart)
Medical history acceptable without decline-level impairments (e.g., mild controlled hypertension, hyperlipidemia)
No recent alcohol/drug abuse (≥5 years remission)
No DWI/DUI/OWI or reckless driving in last 3 years
No hazardous avocations or private aviation
Family history: ≤2 parent/sibling events (death or diagnosis) < age 60 from listed conditions

classes.name: Preferred Tobacco
criteria: Nicotine use within last 12 months (≤1 pack/day for cigarettes)
Total cholesterol/HDL ratio ≤ 5.0, no medication
Blood pressure ≤ 135/85 (age ≤60) or ≤140/90 (age 61+), no treatment
Height/weight within Preferred build limits
No heart disease, diabetes, stroke, cancer in personal history
No alcohol/drug abuse or treatment in last 10 years
No DWI/DUI/OWI or reckless driving in last 5 years
No hazardous avocations or private aviation (private pilots considered individually)
Family history: No parent/sibling death < age 60 from CAD, CVD, diabetes, or cancer

classes.name: Standard Tobacco
criteria: Nicotine use within last 12 months in any form
Height/weight within Standard build limits
Medical history acceptable under tobacco tables (e.g., controlled hypertension, mild hyperlipidemia)
Alcohol or drug abuse evaluated on individual basis
DWI/DUI/OWI or reckless driving evaluated on individual basis
Hazardous avocations and aviation evaluated on individual basis
Family history: evaluated on individual basis

tobacco_guidelines.description: Ameritas differentiates tobacco and nicotine users by duration and frequency, affecting both build-class eligibility and rate classification. Occasional cigar/pipe exceptions apply if confirmed negative on lab tests.

classifications.classification: No nicotine use (including gum, patch, cigar, pipe, e-cigarettes) in past 5 years. Up to 2 cigars/month allowed if cotinine-negative.
No nicotine use in past 2 years. Up to 2 cigars/month allowed if cotinine-negative.
No nicotine use in past 12 months. Up to 2 cigars/month allowed if cotinine-negative.
No nicotine use in past 12 months. Up to 2 cigars/month allowed if cotinine-negative.
Nicotine use within last 12 months (≤1 pack/day for cigarettes). Cholesterol and BP targets same as Preferred Nontobacco.
Nicotine use within last 12 months. Build and medical thresholds follow Standard Nontobacco except for nicotine use.
Medical cannabis use is underwritten; recreational moderate use may qualify for Nontobacco or Standard Nontobacco. Heavy use = Tobacco rates or Decline.

financial_underwriting.description: Ameritas uses income-multiple guidelines to justify face amount relative to economic need. Financial documentation is required on large face amounts or when premium-to-income exceeds thresholds.

special_considerations.description: Ameritas underwriters evaluate additional factors such as residence/travel, avocations, aviation, foreign national status, and military service that may alter eligibility or rating.

factors.guideline: Full documentation (passport, visa) required. Best consideration usually Standard; Preferred may be allowed for 'A‐List' countries. All exam/lab work must be completed in the U.S. Max issue age 75. No accelerated or teleunderwriting for these applicants.
Must complete all requirements in the U.S. Eligible if holding an approved visa or green card. Max issue age 75. No accelerated underwriting.
Up to 30 days/year in non-excluded countries is acceptable without extra rating. >30 days requires detailed trip information and underwriter review; certain destinations may be declined.
May not qualify if stationed in high-risk regions; typically limited to <2 weeks/year outside U.S. Underwriting discretion applies.

factors.factor: Applicants Who Do Not Speak English
factors.guideline: Agent must be fluent in applicant's native language. All paperwork must be completed in English. Variable products not available if applicant cannot read/write English.

Ages 18–50: $100k–$2M face (all life products). Ages 51–60: $100k–$1M face. No major medical conditions, no hazardous occupations/avocations, no recent DUI/DWI, no premium financing. Preferred/Standard risk classes only.
Ages 18–70, up to $5M total face across Ameritas companies. Applicants complete interview + mini‐exam (blood, urine, vitals) as needed based on age & amount.

Recreational scuba to 100ft, private aviation, racing, etc. require underwriter review. Preferred classes not available for high‐risk depths/hours. Aviation Exclusion Rider required for pilots with recent activity.
Active duty considered; Special Forces automatically ineligible. Foreign deployments evaluated individually. Aviation roles (military pilot) usually rated with flat extra.
